text: Walter Edward Fauntroy (born February 6, 1933) is an American politician, civil rights activist and criminal. He is also a former delegate to the United States House of Representatives. He was a candidate for the 1972 and 1976 Democratic presidential nominations. In 2012, Fauntroy disappeared and presumably fled the United States after a bench warrant was issued for his arrest. In 2016, Fauntroy returned to the United States and was arrested at Washington Dulles International Airport. He had been hiding in Ajman, the capital of the Emirate of Ajman in the United Arab Emirates. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:1972 United States presidential candidates Category:1976 United States presidential candidates Category:American criminals Category:American civil rights activists Category:United States representatives Category:Politicians from Washington, D.C. Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Walter Fauntroy
